document.docAuthor: Kluge, Nikita J., Gattolliat, Jean-Luc, Salles, Frederico F. & Novikova, Eugenia A.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Afrotropical genus Susua Lugo-Ortiz & McCafferty 1998 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae: Protopatellata)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Afrotropical genus Susua Lugo-Ortiz & McCafferty 1998 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae: Protopatellata)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dabulamanzia
sp. n. : Gillies 1999 : 53.

Cheleocloeon sigiensis Gillies 2001 : 23
(♂ and ♀ imago, larva).

Susua sigiensis : Kluge, Gattolliat & Salles 2017 : 402
.

Material examined. Holotype
( NHM ): TANZANIA , Upper Sigi R., below Ukunywi, Amani,
23.II.
[19]91, B551: L-I ♂ (male imago in spirit, larval skin on slide QR code 010016901)
.
Paratypes
( NHM ): the same locality and date, B552: L-I ♀ (female imago in spirit, forewing on slide QR code 0 10016902, larval skin on slide QR code 0100169001); B553: L-I ♂ (male imago in spirit, forewing and hind wing on slide QR code 0 10016903, larval skin on slide QR code 010016910); the same locality,
1.VII.
[19]62, A 471-2
:
2 I
♂ ; 16/17.II. [19]63, A 653
: 1 I ♂.
Nontype specimen
( NHM ): Chemka, Amani, Tanganyika,8/
9.XII.
[19]62, A 584
: 1 I ♂.
Other topotypes:
TANZANIA , Tanga Province, Usambara Mountains , Amani , Upper Sigi River , 5°06'S , 38°38'E ,
19.VIII–2.IX.2016
, coll. N. Kluge & L. Sheyko : 1 L-S/I ♂ {number [XXXIX](2)}, 1 L-S ♂ {number [XXXIX](3)}, 1 L-S-I ♀ {number [XXXIX](5)}, 1 L-S ♀ {number [XXX](9)}
,
12 larvae ( ZIN ).
Other localities:
TANZANIA , Morogoro Province, Uluguru Mountains : Kinole , basin of River Ruvu , 6°54'S , 37°45'E ,
27–30.VII.2017
, coll. N. Kluge & L. Sheyko : 3L-S-I ♂ {numbers [V](11), [V](30), [VI](4)A}, 2 L-S ♂ {number [VI](4)A}, 2 L-S-I ♀ {numbers [V](8), [VI](4)A}, 1 L-S ♀ {number [V](30)}
,
15 larvae ( ZIN );
River Morogoro in Morogoro
,
31.VII.2017
, coll. N. Kluge & L. Sheyko : 1 L/S ♀ ( ZIN ). Udzungwa Mountains , River Msosa (tributary of Great Ruaha ), Msosa Camp ( 9 km S

Mbuyuni), 7°33'S / 36°32'E, 5–10.VIII.2017 , coll. N. Kluge & L.Sheyko: 3 L-S-I♂ {numbers [VIII](9), [XI](7)}, 3 L-S♂ {numbers [X](11), [XII](5)B}, 1 L-S-I♀ {number [XII](5)B}, 2 L-S♀ {number [XII](5)B}, 12 larvae (ZIN).
HYPODERMAL COLORATION. In immature larva not expressed; in last instar larva preparing to molt to subimago, abdominal terga with reddish marks as in imago.

STRUCTURE. Larval head and mouthparts as characterized above [see Crassabwa /g1 (1), (7)–(11) and diagnosis of
Susua
]. In contrast to
S. niandanensis
, labium with mentum colorless, lacking contrasting sclerites ( Fig. 16 ); labial palp with 3rd segment blunt ( Fig. 5 ).

RESPIRATORY MOVEMENTS. Absent. Living larva often keeps its tergalii perpendicular to body axis, that is characteristic for larvae whose tergalii are able for respiratory movements; shape of tergalii of
Susua sigiensis
is similar to that of
Dabulamanzia
and
Cheleocloeon
, whose tergalii are able for respiratory movements. Despite of this, larva of
Susua sigiensis
never makes respiratory movements by its tergalii and cannot live in container with stagnant water longer than several hours (in contrast to sympatric species of
Dabulamanzia
and
Cheleocloeon
, whose larvae can live in such condition during many days).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4. Holotype of
Susua sigiensis
: 1, dorsal view; 2–3, genitalia; 4, larval exuviae.

FIGURES 5–9. Larva of
Susua sigiensis
. 5, labium (at left ventral view with muscles of glossa, paraglossa and palp shown by interrupted lines; at right dorsal view); 6, labrum (dorsal view); 7, apex of left maxilla; 8–9, biting edges of left and right mandibles. Abbreviations: ds1, ds2, ds3, dentisetae.

FIGURES 10–16. Exuviae of last instar larvae of
Susua sigiensis
. 10, caudalii; 11, right half of pronotum and mesonotum; 12, abdominal sterna, terga and caudalii; 13, fore leg; 14, middle leg with meso- and metathoracic pleura, half of metanotum and hind protopteron; 15, hind leg; 16, labium. Abbreviations: I–X, abdominal segments I–X; ppt, hind protopteron. Black triangle shows point where patella-tibial suture crosses inner margin.

FIGURES 17–27. Larva of
Susua sigiensis
. 17, base of tibia of fore leg, anterior view (setae on posterior side shown by interrupted lines); 18, apex of femur and base of tibia of middle leg, anterior view (setae on posterior side shown by interrupted lines); 19, claw; 20–26, tergalii I–VII; 27, paraproct.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Subimago .
CUTICULAR COLORATION. Head colorless. Pronotum with light brown and colorless areas. Mesonotum light brown, sutures at anterolateral part dark brown ( Fig. 51 ). Thoracic pleura and sterna at most part nearly colorless with brown microtrichia, certain sclerites brown ( Fig. 49 ). Legs nearly colorless with brown microtrichia. Abdominal terga and sterna very light brownish with brown microtrichia; terga with brownish sublateral markings. Cerci colorless with brown spines.
TEXTURE. On all legs of male and female all tarsomeres covered by pointed microlepides.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 28–33. Exuviae of left half of pronotum and mesonotum of last instar larva of
Susua sigiensis
. 28, general view; 29–31, bunches of spatulate setae on places shown by arrows; 32, scales on pronotum; 33, scales on posterior part of fore protopteron.

FIGURES 34–40. Exuviae of abdomen of last instar larva of
Susua sigiensis
. 34, tergum I; 35, tergum II; 36, tergum V; 37, tergum VIII; 38, tergum IX (black triangle shows midline); 39, tergum X; 40, sternum VII.

FIGURES 41–46.
Susua sigiensis
. 41, anterior part of larva; 42, anterior part of female imago; 43–44, hind leg of imago and its subimaginal exuviae; 45–46, the same of another specimen. Abbreviations: R, unpaired median ridge on mesonotum; S, paired bunches of spatulate setae on pronotum and mesonotum.

FIGURES 47–51.
Susua sigiensis
. 47–48, female imago, dorsal and ventral view; 49, subimaginal exuviae of left pleuron; 50, male imago; 51, male imago with subimaginal exuviae.

FIGURES 52–57.
Susua sigiensis
. 52, hind wing; 53, penis, ventral view; 54–55, genitals of male imago and its subimaginal exuviae, ventral view; 56, genitals of another specimen (penis dotted, its hidden parts shown by interrupted lines; median styligeral muscle, gonovectal muscles and right gonostylar muscle shown by interrupted lines; areas of anterior attachment of median paraproctal muscles shown by dotted lines); 57, subimaginal genitals developing under larval cuticle. Abbreviations: gs1, gs2, gs3, 1st–3rd segments of gonostylus; usg, unistyliger.

subSubSection.paragraph: Gonostyli: 1 st segment with sharply projected apical-median angle, 2nd segment widened apically, 3rd segment elongate and clavate ( Figs 2, 4 , 54, 56 ; Gillies 2001 : Fig. 3 ). Each gonovectis with apex sharply widened; proximally with projection serving as place of attachment of gonovectal muscle ( Figs 53, 54, 56 ). Penial bridge medially with unpaired truncate projection of variable width and height ( Figs 2, 4 , 53, 54, 56 ). Unpaired styligeral muscle well-developed ( Fig. 56 ).
Eggs . Irregular oval, 0.15 mm length. Chorion with prominent ridges forming net; some of transverse ridges interrupted; each cell with small protuberance in middle ( Figs 58–61 ).
Dimension. Fore wing length of male and female 5 mm .
Distribution. Usambara, Uluguru and Udzungwa Mountains in Tanzania .

Discussion. Gillies (1999) preliminary reported this species as belonging to the genus
Dabulamanzia
. However, this species differs from
Dabulamanzia
by the shape of the labial palp, whose 2nd segment has an innerapical projection, and 3rd segment is narrow ( Fig. 5 ; Gillies 2001 : Fig. 7 ), while in all species of
Dabulamanzia
2nd segment of the labial palp has no inner-apical projection, and 3rd segment is widened.

Subsequently Gillies (2001) described this species as a representative of the genus
Cheleocloeon
. Corrected diagnosis of the genus
Cheleocloeon
, based on reliably associated imagoes, subimagoes and larvae of various species, is given in a previous paper ( Kluge 2016 ). Differences between the species sigiense [
Cheleocloeon
] and the genus
Cheleocloeon
, which proceed from the original description, are: (1) sigiense [ Ch. ] has no patella-tibial suture on larval fore leg, while
Cheleocloeon
belongs to Anteropatellata and all its species have patella-tibial suture equally developed on all larval legs; (2) sigiense [ Ch. ] has hind wings in female, while in
Cheleocloeon
hind wings can be present or absent in male, but never present in female; (3) in sigiense [ Ch. ] inner-apical projection of the second segment of labial palp is much smaller that in all species of
Cheleocloeon
; (4) in sigiense [ Ch. ] last (third) segment of gonostylus is much longer than in all species of
Cheleocloeon
. Differences between sigiense [
Cheleocloeon
] and the genus
Cheleocloeon
, which proceed from examination of the new material described above, are: (5) sigiense [ Ch. ] has one subapical stout seta on each larval femur ( Fig. 18 ), while all species of
Cheleocloeon
have two subapical setae on each larval femur; (6) gonovectes of sigiense [ Ch. ] have widened apices ( Figs 53, 54, 56 ), while all species of
Cheleocloeon
have uniform structure of gonovectes with apices hooked and pointed.
